moves.1. d4: Hi all! This is a game between me and my long-standing Arch-Rival, who has only recently come to GameKnot. He is playing White, and before this game the score between us is 1.5-1.5. So there's a lot to play for...
moves.1... Nf6: I play the move for Black which points the way to main line Queen Pawn openings, such as the King's Indian, Nimzo-Indian, or Benoni. The benefit of this move is that Black has more or less complete freedom to choose the opening.
moves.2. Nf3 g6: Pointing the way to a King's Indian Defence.
moves.3. c3: This solid move, my Arch-Rival told me, is often played to bypass the sharp play and the theoretical lines of the King's Indian Defence, also blunting Black's fianchettoed bishop. Annoying for me, as I am more comfortable with main line KID.
moves.3... Bg7 4. g3 O-O 5. Bg2 d5 6. O-O Nbd7: Both sides develop, in nearly symmetrical fashion.
moves.7. Bg5 Re8 8. Nbd2 e5 9. dxe5 Nxe5 10. N: Mass exchanges in the centre, opening up the position more: this is a far cry from the main line King's Indian Defence, and much more open.
moves.12. Re1 c6: Solidifying my advantage in central control.
moves.13. e4 Bg4 14. Qc2 dxe4 15. Nxe4 Nxe4 16: A pin...but sadly, not one that wins material.
moves.17. Rxe8+ Qxe8 18. Qd2 Rd8 19. Re1: Fine. You harass my queen, I harass yours.
moves.19... Qd7: I prefer keeping my queen in a central, dominant position with ...Qd7, than hide in the corner with ...Qf8. This is a CRITICAL BLUNDER BY ME.
moves.20. Qxd7 Rxd7: I recapture my queen. I had, yes, foreseen lines with 21.Re8+ Bf8 22.Rb8 Rd2, which I think are narrowly advantageous for me.
moves.21. Re8+ Bf8 22. Bh6: AAAAARGH!!!!!!!! No! Dead in the water! Thwarted by an irritating bishop attack! Why? This is exactly as GM Yasser Seirawan describes this combination in "Winning Chess Combinations" and I fell right for it! No! An embarrassing loss against my ARCH-RIVAL!
moves.22... Rd1+ 23. Bf1 Bh3: I may as well replicate the attack. There's nothing else I can do.
moves.24. Rxf8#: Owch. 2.5-1.5 to you, jelly...this is not yet over...
